result.execSummary:
The defendant Fazon D. Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and stayed, with work release/huber.

Conditions:  

Participate in all P/P assessments and recommendations for treatment.  Also, participate in all assessments and treatments recommended by HHS.  Participate in programming recommended by the two agencies.  That programming may include specified housing.

DNA sample to be provided, if not already provided.

Pay costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Fazon D. Davis
Current: 254 E Mill St, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 02-14-2017)
Prior: 164 W. Court Street #4, Richland Center, WI 53581

Agent Barman's request for the confidential criminal complaint from this case for use by def's treatment providers.  Court allows release of this document to the agent following redaction of victim's name.  Name redacted, this document has been provided to DOC.
1 document provided for 3 cases - scanned to and stored in 14CF58

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. McDougal for status in 14FO72, 14CF58, 14CM31, and 14CM88.

Counsel inform the Court that the parties have reached an agreement to resolve these matters.  DA Harper details the agreement for the record:

14CF58 - waiver of prelim needs to be completed and info filed with an amendment of the charge.  Recommended dispo:  12 mo jail imposed/stayed for 5 years probation.  Complaint in this case to be sealed.

14CM31 - def will be pleading to count 1/disorderly conduct and count 3/resisting.

14CM88 - def will be pleading to count 1/damage to property, count 2/resisting, and count 3/bail jumping.

Per the agreement, all other counts to be dismissed/read-in.  Also, 14FO72 to be dismissed.

DA states that the recommended disposition for the misdemeanors is 30 days jail imposed/stayed on each count, consecutive to one another for probation of 2 years.  Probation to include requirement that def participate in all assessments and treatment recommended by probation and all assts/treatment recommended by Richland County HHS; participate in all programming recommended by both.  Re HHS assts/treatment, those may include specified housing.  Costs to be imposed on each count.

14CF58 - def waives right to prelim and Court conducts the prelim waiver colloquy.  Information filed with charge of mental hard to child (an amendment of the original charge).  Reading waived.  Def pleads no contest.

14CM31 - def pleads no contest to counts 1 and 3.

14CM88 - def pleads no contest to counts 1, 2 and 3.  

Court's colloquy re pleas.  Finding of guilty to the pleaded counts.  14FO72 dismissed.  Count 2 of 14CM31 dismissed.  Count 4 of 14CM88 dismissed.
Status conference on October 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.

DA Harper, Def in custody, and Atty. McDougal for 14FO72, 14CF58, 14CM31, and 14CM88.  Counsel ask for setover to a later date; not ready for resolution.  In 14CM88, Court conducts the adjourned initial.  Formal reading waived; NG entered.  All matters set for further status Oct. 29 at 9.  Status conference scheduled for 10-29-2014 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Def in person with counsel, Atty Lisa McDougal. State by Atty Harper. Request to reschedule this matter to 10/15/14 at 9:00 a.m.
Status conference on October 9, 2014 at 11:30 am.

14CF58/init
14FO72/intake
 14CM88/init--Formal reading waived. Court informs def of charges/max possible penalties. NG pleas entered. Court directs clerk to enter NG pleas. 
 14CM31/status
Defendant Fazon D. Davis in court with Atty Lisa McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty M. requests matter be setover for AIA in 14CF58. DA requsts $5000 signature bond and no contact with I.T. (DOB 02/05/97). Court notes bond is already set for this matter. All matters set for status on 10/09/14 @ 11:30.

Atty Mc also requests revocation and warrant in case 12CF112 be set for that same date and time.  Status conference scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 11:30 am.
